intro: Iridorkis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf iridorkis, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spikes of delicate, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Iridorkis angustifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a valuable addition to both horticultural and ecological settings.
